intro: Trichosporum mjoebergii, commonly known as the African hair grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets, and it is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Trichosporum mjoebergii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
